intro: Hieraciodes spathulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed hieraciodes, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in spring and summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, often covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance.
